title: Cellroti support changes
body:
* SSL support for cellroti API calls
* Explicit check in cellroti export wizard for connection/authentication to cellroti

title: Include usage in retraining wizard
body:
* When destroying a mini-iteration ensure that any parent references are deleted as well
* Include step-by-step usage instruction in retraining wizard
* Add summary of patches w.r.t. lowest score and number of patches with scores below 0.8 threshold

title: Detectable finder mining type
body:
Currently, to find false negatives, we can use zdist differencer mining type. In practice, due to false positives at lower zdist, zdist differencer shows lot more clips than is actually necessary.

We can hypothesize that if a detectable is present in video, it will be seen at least for a few seconds and that at least one frame will have a localization with a high zdist. It is also likely that there are multiple false negatives in the vicinity of the high zdist true positive.

For each detectable, this mining type:
* Selects clips that have at least one high zdist localization
* Does zdist differencer within those clips
* Orders clips in linear time

title: ConfusionFinder doesn't respect primary/secondary det ids
body: ConfusionFinder shows frames that have intersections that are not between primary and secondary det ids.

title: Sort and track mining progress
body:
* List mining in chronological order in index
* Within each mining, ability to mark a set as being "done"

Items from issue #7 
- [x] Jump to specific frame number
- [x] Click on lower time-bar takes to center of the selection box, instead of the beginning as is now (similar to top time-bar)
- [x] Manually mark set as being in `done` state
- [x] Make 'Hide Diagonal' in confusionFinder view a check-button so it's clear when it is active or not
- [x] Add *Created* column showing creation date/time in the mining list. (Currently labeled as *Listing minings*, change to 'Existing minings'?) Either add sorting ability in that column or sort by latest at top.

title: Model re-training support
body:
Support for:
https://github.com/zigvu/chia/wiki/Model-training-overview

title: Production error tracking
body:
Rather than query logs frequently based on production issues, use an automated system to open github issue with stack trace of application failure:

* Use https://github.com/dockyard/party_foul
* When ruby error occurs, automatically logged and tracked
* When JS error occurs, push an ajax with error description to rails - handle in application_controller.rb to send to `party_foul`

title: Enhance ConfusionFinder and ZdistDifferencer minings
body:
* ConfusionFinder - Put button to prevent diagonal cells count values from overwhelming non-diagonal cell values
* ZdistDifferencer - Put in heatmap in mining creation

title: Upgrade rails infrastructure
body:
* Move from single threaded MRI to multi-threaded Rubinius: Allows us to write code that leverages threaded designs
* Move from single-user Webrick to multi-user Puma: Allows us to use same server in both development and production version
* Refactor Rabbit connectors to start connection per worker by using `on_worker_boot` hook: Allows us to scale to multiple users/processes using rabbit

title: Cellroti support
body:
* Port `sports` sections from cellroti
* Create sport `events` as annotations
* Create `export` workflow to send specific data to cellroti:
 - `sports` (meta) data
 - sport `events` (meta) data
 - Link kheer detectable_id and cellroti detectable_id
 - Localization data for video

title: Mining for sequential viewing of video
body:
Create new mining type to allow for sequential viewing of video for:

* Review of annotations
* Annotating game events

Since this mining type displays clips in sequence regardless of whether that clip has localizations or not, no localization filter is applied.

title: Improvements to kheer
body:
Implementation of some parts of issue #7 

Items:

- [x] Display annotation list in alphabetical order or DetId order
- [x] For set mining, show which videos are present in each set
- [x] For localization bbox, zdist falls out of background white area
- [x] Spinner in mining creation when steps take long time to execute
- [x] Make SNR shown in annotations compatible with patch extraction config (i.e. within 227x227)
- [x] Link to clip show of video

title: Delayed job for cache creation
body:
New mining type requires creation of cached data for each KheerJob. Doing this in the thread that reads from Rabbit will block ingesting other KheerJob that are being processed.

This issue spins out a delayed job upon all data transmission from Rabbit for a KheerJob such that the job:
* Creates all caching data
* Changes state of KheerJob to complete upon creation of caching data

title: Upgrade timeline chart for mining analysis
body:
The current timeline chart was designed with two-detectable mining scenarios and hence when more than two detectables are present, their scores overlap in the timeline chart making it hard to visually distinguish which of the detectables has positive scores.

This issue redesigns the timeline chart such that:
* Scores of multiple detectables are "stacked" on top of each other so that all scores are simultaneously visible
* Information of annotations and detectable intersections are displayed
* Background color of chart is easily changeable between black and white so that when non-contrasting colors are shown, it easy to create contrast

title: Introduce new mining modalities
body:
#### Motivation

This issue introduces a few new mining modalities to allow different types of mining to be done in videos:

* ZdistFinder: See all localization of select detectables at particular zdist values. This type does NOT filter based on spatial intersection - instead choosing to show those intersections as visual feature in the timeline graph. This is the most-basic type of filtering and shows the maximum amount of data. This is useful for FP and FN mining but not so much for cross-class confusions.

* ChiaVersionComparer: Compare performance of one or more detectables at selected zdists, across chia versions. Such analysis might give us an early indication of whether the model is getting better for that detectable (e.g., if reducing zdist slightly doesn't significantly change output bboxes across chia versions, then we can assume the model has gotten better.)

* ZdistDifferencer: See all localizations for a detectable that appears in one zdist but not in another (higher) zdist. This is useful for FN mining since a detectable that is seen at zdist `0` but not in zdist `4` for example, is a good FN example. However, at present, due to presence of large cross-class confusion, this modality is not very effective for FN mining.

* ConfusionFinder: See all localizations where two detectable "confuse" with each other at some zdist, scale and intersection threshold. Confusion is determined by the amount of intersection - an intersection of 0 means that the bbox of detectables doesn't touch each other and an overlap of 1 means the bbox completely overlap for at least one detectable involved. This tool is useful for cross-class mining and figuring out which detectable is performing acceptably at what zdist.

title: Production mode support
body: * Config for DBs in production mode

title: Export annotation for chia consumption
body:
Chia patch extraction is not aware of `ChiaVersionId` within kheer. If annotations are made in the same frame across chia versions, then current export only exports annotations from the selected chia version. This is the correct expected behavior from `import/export` point of view when we have to backup kheer database. However, this is not the expected behavior for patch extraction in chia.

This issue creates a new rake task: `export_annotation_for_chia`. 

For each frame which has annotation in current `ChiaVersionId`:
1. Combines all annotation in current `ChiaVersionId` into a single JSON
2. Sets all annotations across all `ChiaVersionId` (except selected `ChiaVersionId`) for this frame to `_AVOID_` and merge to single JSON
3. Merge JSON from 1 and 2
4. Output to file

title: Ability to extract annotation/frames from clips rather than video
body:
* In addition to video id, we should also export clip path, clip id and clip frame number
* Each annotation export should also include 4 "_AVOID_" class to account for embedded frame counter (introduced by #10) at the corner of each frame

This is a follow up to issue #11 and not immediately needed since we are extracting frames from original video rather than clips.

title: Rank-based navigation across large dataset
body:
### Problem

Each game currently has ~300K localization bboxes (across 3 zdist values) and ~200 clips. After each model iteration, we could evaluate 8 games to mine FP patches. That would give us a total of ~2.5M localization bboxes and 16K clips. Presumably, from a re-training point of view, not all localization bboxes are valuable. If we assume a ranking function (tracked by issue #12) that can rank frames of all these 16K clips, then we could aggregate the frame-level rank to clip-level rank. 

Once we have ranked clips, we will need mechanism to rotate them in the UI as user mines for more FP patches. Within a clip, we will also need to navigate based on frame rank.

This issue tracks the addition of rank based navigation to kheer. To enable user to also navigate based on time, that functionality will also be available based on initial filter selection. Until issue #12 is available, we will simulate frame ranking by the highest zdist score of any class in that frame. 

### New workflow

* User: Establish a "mining session"
* User: Select chia version, classes and videos (based on meta-data)
* System: Run large query to rank all frames within selected videos. Based on frame ranks, rank clips. Group clips into "sets" of 5 clips each.
* System: Send the first set to user
* User: Hit "f" for the next highest ranking frame within the clip
* System: After all (or at most 50) highest ranking frame of a clip has been mined, go to next clip
* System: Track each user activity/inactivity per frame - assume unlimited bandwidth and storage and store all user activity

title: Rabbit queue names based on environment
body: Per Khajuri issue 104 (https://github.com/zigvu/khajuri/issues/104), we need to split log queues based on development/production environments.

title: JS crash on clip navigation on Linux FF
body:
### To reproduce:
* Navigate to: /analysis/annotations/temp
* Seek to frame ~2024
* Slow seek or frame forward to frame 2045

### Behavior:
* Frame 2045 and 2046 are marked as `red` (time synch issues)
* Cannot navigate past 2046 using frame forward
* If played, jumps to end of video

### Expected behavior:
* In windows above behavior is not seen - expect same in Linux

### JS Error console dump:

#### FF Linux version <38.0.5:

        Media resource http://localhost:3000/data/1/clips/2.mp4 could not be decoded.
        InvalidStateError: An attempt was made to use an object that is not, or is no longer, usable

#### FF Linux version >= 38.0.5:

        Media resource http://localhost:3000/data/1/clips/2.mp4 could not be decoded.
        InvalidStateError: An attempt was made to use an object that is not, or is no longer, usable
            self.video.currentTime = ft;

title: Smart frame filter designs
body:
For efficient filtering of frames for high-value FP/FN mining -
(Some of these need further discussion before implementation)

- [ ] Overlapping localization bboxes, with overlap ratio selection (both with/without class dependency)
- [ ] Frames with more localization bboxes in higher zDist than in lower zDist values 
- [ ] Temporal vicinity - bbox of same class in specified number of adjacent evaluated frames
- [ ] No localization of same class in adjacent scales (needs new post processing?)
- [ ] Frames with *heat* in patches but no bbox for the class (for FN and x-class confusion)
- [ ] Specified classes seen in same frame (for potential x-class confusion)
- [ ]

title: Annotation import/export update
body:
* The output folder structure of annotation export doesn't work with the import folder structure making it tricky to import annotations across videos/chia versions.

* Annotation export broken due to rename from Video -> Clip in #8

title: Embedded frame number and canvas overlaid displays
body:
Time-based frame-counting in JavaScript is prone to error (anecdotally, incorrect by a few frames about 1-5% of time). One way to solve is embed frame number in each frame of video and parse that in javascript to augment the time-based frame-counting.

#### Requirements:
* Use least amount of pixel area
* Should work in all encoding scheme even when compression of frames is high

#### Implementation:
* During clip creation from video, embed multi-pixel square boxes in fixed location in frame. Color and position of the square box denotes the frame number
* In JavaScript, once the frame is rendered to canvas, look at average color values of each square box and infer frame number
* Overlay this frame number (and that gotten using time stamp) in a separate layer in the canvas area

title: Config Manager
body:
#### Requirements:
* Config versioning and association with ChiaVersionId
* Edit config through UI
* Export config to khajuri

#### Implementation plan:
* Separate config sections based on system (kheer, khajuri, chia, general)
* Versioning such that some section can evolve faster than others (e.g., message queue names will probably not evolve as much as chia model path)
* JSON file export for taking config to other systems

title: Rabbitmq interface + multi-video analysis
body:
RabbitMq use cases:
1. Save post-processing data for each quanta
2. Get heatmap data for JS plotting

Multi-video use cases:
1. Load only those `clips` (small segments of 1024 frame at most) and associated data to reduce bandwidth and compute needs

title: Refactor data manager
body: Centralize all data access routines through data manager API and limit access of DataStore and FilterStore data structures to outside classes.

title: Heatmap display
body:
Heatmap display:
1. Heatmap `on`/`off` button
2. Heatmap displayed only when video is paused
3. The class for which heatmap is displayed is the same as the class selected in `AnnotationList`

Technical plan:
1. Save `cellmap`, `patchmap` and `colormap` for each chia ID
2. Upon application initialization, send `cellmap` and `colormap` to browser
3. Once playback is paused, upon hitting the heatmap `on` button, send a ajax request to rails for heatmap data with `(videoId, frameId, classId, scale)`
4. Upon heatmap data request, rails reads raw scores from mongo and creates intensity `cellmap` based on raw scores and `patchmap`
5. JS uses intensity `cellmap` array values and `colormap` to overlay a heatmap on top of currently displaying frame canvas. All other drawing is done on TOP of this heatmap

title: Data input from Khajuri, training output to chia
body:
Basic workflow for import/export of data:

* Create new chia version, program (e.g., game), video (e.g., quantas)
* Change filters to allow selection of chia version for new annotation
* Import new data from khajuri (False positive mining)
* Import new data from chia patch evaluation (False negative mining)
* Export JSON of annotations
* Export patch selection

title: Initial feature add/change/updates & hot keys
body:
**Features:**
- [x] Visible differentiation for annotated box vs. localization bbox
- [x] High contrast/flashy color(?) for annotation vertices 
- [x] Show SNR in annotated box (wrt 256x256 patch size at scale 1.0)
- [x] Display play rate - 0.50x, 1.00x, 2.00x etc.

- [x] Delete button to delete selected annotation (no backspace in Mac?) - implemented with `d` char
- [x] Show/hide video playback buttons
- [x] Add scale selection in data filter


**Hot buttons:**
- [x] `e` one frame forward 
- [x] `w` one frame in reverse
- [x] `v` 10 frame forward
- [x] `q` 10 frame in reverse
- [x] `f` next frame forward with localization bbox for selected class(es)
- [x] `r` previous frame in reverse with localization bbox for selected class(es)
- [x] `space` pause/play
- [x] `+` fast-forward on each press by 1.50x, 2.00x, 3.00x, 4.00x
- [x] `-` slow-forward on each press by 0.67x, 0.50x, 0.33x, 0.25x
- [x] `=` play at normal rate (1.00x)
- [x] `d` delete selected annotation (by mouse left-click)
